entry.title: Weekend Linkfest 21.6.2013
entry.content:
I was very busy, so I skipped two linkfests. Here is a long one this week!

Statistics and Machine Learning

  • Probabilistic Programming and Bayesian Methods for Hackers
  • Feature Hashing | TechTalks.tv
  • Bayesian Inference and Learning in Gaussian Process State-Space Models with Particle MCMC
  • Excellent Google Papers for 2012
  • Principles of ML Benchmarking
  • Using Metadata to find Paul Revere - Kieran Healy
  • Deep Learning Tutorial - NAACL 2013
  • The Value of Adding Randomness « Normal Deviate
  • Recent Advances and Trends in Large Scale Kernel Methods
  • Bayes' Theorem in the 21st Century
  • Statistics.com - Glossary of statistical terms
  • SAS Dominates Analytics Job Market; R up 42% | r4stats.com
  • What statistics should do about big data: problem forward not solution backward | Simply Statistics
  • Machine learning classifier gallery
  • Neural Networks 2: Evaluation | The Shape of Data
  • SIMPSON’S PARADOX EXPLAINED « Normal Deviate
  • Fast dropout training
  • ICML 2013 Papers
  • Deep Learning – A Term To Know | Data Science 101

R Package of the Week

  • testthat

Paper of the Week

  • Feature Hashing for Large Scale Multitask Learning
  • Algebraic classifiers: a generic approach to fast cross-validation, online training, and parallel training

Programming

  • Visualizing Correlations with Corrgrams | Data Analysis Visually Enforced
  • Example of unit testing R code with testthat | The Endeavour
  • Testing MCMC code, part 1: unit tests – Building Intelligent Probabilistic Systems
  • Testing MCMC code, part 2: integration tests – Building Intelligent Probabilistic Systems
  • More code and images from “Displaying time series, spatial and space-time data with R”
  • Want cheap high-performance computing at scale like Google? Look to GPUs
  • Parallel Python with IPCluster and Wakari
  • LIBSVM 101
  • Using Quandl in R
  • Marginally Interesting: The Real-Time Big Data Landscape
  • Mahout for R Users | Drunks&Lampposts
  • HLearn cross-validates >400x faster than Weka
  • The ghc-vis User Guide
  • Installation and quick start — nose 1.3.0 documentation
  • Code à la Mode: Drawing DAGs: LaTeX Solution
  • Recomendation System in R
  • rCharts
  • Go non-linear with Vowpal Wabbit - FastML
  • On Scala
  • Timely Portfolio: R Plotting Financial Time Series
  • Building Machine Learning Systems with Python | Meta Rabbit
  • Improve The Efficiency in Joining Data with Index | Yet Another Blog in Statistical Computing
  • HLearn's code is shorter and clearer than Weka's

Elsewhere

  • Media for Thinking the Unthinkable on Vimeo
